description.narrative: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 92 developing countries.

activity-description.narrative: The Accelerator Lab will work with partners in the country on addressing development challenges through system transformation and strategic innovation

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses. 2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies 3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs 3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. 3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network. 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

comment.narrative: 1.1.- 5 new data sources per year 1.2 - 6 different type of data sources per year 1.3 - 35 new potential solutions per lab per year 1.4 - 5 innovation methods per Action Plan. 2.1 - At least 6 blogs or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2 - At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 - At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. 2.4 - At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. 3.1 - The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network.48 interaction per year 3.2 - 25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3 - The Accelerator Lab Networks work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. - The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account 3.4 - Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. - Identify and engage with 5 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

1.1.- 5 new data sources per year • Waste audit in the city of Skopje - City Experiment Fund • Mapping of key strategic documents in the country - working with the DG unit on the National Development Strategy • Mapping of key stakeholders in the country - working with the DG unit on National Development Strategy • Ethnographic data from the City of Skopje as part of the Deep listening process for the City Experiment Fund • Media sentiment analysis • Focus groups, informal workers 1.2 - 6 different type of data sources per year • Qualitative o Deep listening o Focus groups o City Audit o Media sentiment analysis • Quantitative o Survey on SDGs ( Private sector and digitalization) o DPPD 1.3 - 35 new potential solutions per lab per year • 36 solutions published on the Global AccLab solutions platform. These solutions are across 12 SDGs, and cover 83 thematic areas. Solutions are collected from 14 locations within the country. 1.4 - 5 innovation methods per Action Plan. We have used the following innovative methods within the Action Plan: 1. Portfolio Approach (in City Experiment Fund) 2. Co-design ( NDS, Fridays@the LAB, Local Solutions Platform, and Environment Unit ) 3. Stakeholder Mapping ( NDS, City Experiment Fund) 4. 3D Modeling ( NDS, UNDP CO Office scanning) 5. Anticipatory Governance ( NDS) 6. Mapping Solutions – a way forward to understand the ecosystem, and be able to identify white spaces, and entry points (digitalization and City Experiment Fund)
2.1 - At least 6 blogs or other (substantial) media posts published per year. We have published a total of 9 blogposts published in 2021. A] Training the synapses to be a network https://www.mk.undp.org/content/north-macedonia/en/home/blog/training-the-synapses-to-be-a-network.html B] How impact driven startups can expand to global markets https://www.mk.undp.org/content/north-macedonia/en/home/blog/how-impact-driven-startups-can-expand-to-global-markets.html C] Learning about informality https://www.mk.undp.org/content/north-macedonia/en/home/blog/learning-about-informality.html D] How can we enable transformative change in pursuit of gender equality. https://www.mk.undp.org/content/north-macedonia/en/home/blog/How-can-we-enable-transformative-change-in-pursuit-of-gender-equality.html E] A New Way Forward https://www.mk.undp.org/content/north-macedonia/en/home/blog/A-New-Way-Forward.html F] Fridays at the Lab https://www.mk.undp.org/content/north-macedonia/en/home/blog/fridays-at-the-lab.html G] Ground control to Major Tom https://www.mk.undp.org/content/north-macedonia/en/home/blog/ground-control-to-Major-Tom.html H] Culture of change: myth or reality? https://www.mk.undp.org/content/north-macedonia/en/home/blog/Culture-of-Change-Myth-or-Reality.html I] The Why -when and how of system transformation https://www.mk.undp.org/content/north-macedonia/en/home/blog/The-Why-When-and-How-of-System-Transformation.html https://www.mk.undp.org/content/north-macedonia/en/home/blog/A-New-Way-Forward.html
2.2 - At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. Our support for the development of the National Development Strategy has the government [the Deputy Prime Ministers of North Macedonia] has the government as a partner in the process as well as other UN agencies, and the donor community. The support for the development of the NDS, is a part of our first frontier challenge #Governance #GoodGovernance, and our learning question on how we can redesign our public policy process. In City Experiment Fund we have created partnerships with the academia, private sector and civil society organization. We have been working on close partnership with other UN agencies in few activities ( SDG tool piloting for the stateless in partnership with UNHCR, Green Shark Challenge in partnership with UNICEF). Together with private sector partners we implemented Accelerate 2030 program in North Macedonia, where two startups made it to global program showcasing their work on the SDGs. 2.3 - At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. The Accelerator Lab team had the opportunity to support the Democratic Governance unit within our Country office in a process aimed at supporting the development of a National Development Strategy in our country. Within the National Development Strategy process, UNDPs key partners [national institutions] have adopted [through a session of a Steering Board Committee] the methodological approach that we have proposed to be followed for the development of the NDS. Namely, the methodological approach, co-created in a process including national institutions, CSOs, experts the UNDP country office and other entities has used the Doughnut model of economics as a method of mapping risks and identifying areas where we need to build capabilities in our society. The methodology also adopts a more flexible, learning oriented, humble approach to policymaking that relies on iterations and experimentation. This is something that we believe is closely aligned with the #AccLab method of work. 2.4 - At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. #GoodGovernance, giving actionable knowledge to our Democratic Governance Unit #SluggishEconomy, giving actionable knowledge to our Environment Unit on circularity, and our Inclusive Prosperity Unit on new jobs and skills.
3.1 - The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network.48 interaction per year Completed. Regular meetings with other Labs over the course of 2021, and active participation in the Global Call, Experimenter/Explorer/Solutions Mapping calls. So far, we have had over 50 direct interactions with other colleagues, including presentation of our concepts developed (for example Fridays@theLab), lead two global learning sessions (on the topic of informality); 3.2 - 25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. Presented at global call on using the method of Solutions Mapping, Presented to UNDP colleagues in the CO and AccLab explorers biweekly calls on innovation on Portfolio Approach Presented to Accelerated Lab- Experimenter Call – Public Sector Innovation Experiments in North Macedonia (Doughnut Economic Model) Participation asa speaker in other Lab’s launching event (Launching Event of AccLab Saudi Arabia) Hybrid event on Innovation for System change – where we had indepth discussions on methodologies used through out the year in the Acc LAB North Macedonia Spearheaded the bi-weekly global explorers calls (OCT - Nov) together with the colleague from Ukraine on `portfolio approach, innovative challenges and loosely coupled systems; 4 events related to presenting the SDGs as a business oportunity to startups and business sector, in additon with a hybrid demoday with keynote presentations from the director of the state fund for innovation, representatives of startup accelerators https://www.facebook.com/watch/live/?ref=search&v=411344967049624 3.3 - The Accelerator Lab Networks work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. - The Lab team engages at least once a week across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account 3.4 - Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. - Identify and engage with 5 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.
The launch of the UNDP accelerator Lab showcased in the local media: https://inovativnost.mk/2021/02/16/%D1%83%D0%BD%D0%B4%D0%BF-%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D1%80%D1%82%D1%83%D0%B2%D0%B0-%D0%B0%D0%BA%D1%86%D0%B5%D0%BB%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B0%D1%82%D0%BE%D1%80-%D0%BB%D0%B0%D0%B1%D0%BE%D1%80%D0%B0%D1%82%D0%BE%D1%80/ The prime minister of North Macedonia opens the Accelerator Lab team in the UNDP office in Skopje. Published in one of the core mainstream newspapers in the country: https://vecer.mk/makedonija/video-zaev-novata-akceleratorska-laboratorija-kje-otvori-mozhnosti-za-partnerstva-na-inovativni-razvojni-proekti/ • The official social media pages of the Prime Minister promoted the Accelerator Lab • YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EHgl2vCOigE • Government website: https://vlada.mk/node/24339?ln=mk All the news media sources published for the opening of the Lab on this link: https://time.mk/c/c49152ccf2/zaev-rabotime-da-ja-transformirame-makedonija-kako-nov-regionalen-centar-na-inovacii.html
Presenting the work of the Accelerator Lab team and our portfolio of experiment at the 17th international e-Society.mk conference in 2021. Link to the acknowledgement social media post: https://www.facebook.com/metamorphosis.foundation/posts/10159885639876873
Picture from the promotional materials for the event, and their social media:
The Recursive, an independent community-born online media focused on the emerging tech and startup ecosystems in Southeast Europe (SEE), writes about the Accelerate2030 program https://therecursive.com/accelerate2030-to-help-macedonian-startups-develop-and-scale-sustainable-solutions/ UN RCO MK with a story around Youth in Macedonia as a driving force in the SDG forefillment. / overview on how the Accelerate 2030 program can help impact driven startups can their solutions using UNs global network https://northmacedonia.un.org/en/143226-lead-way-youth-north-macedonia-are-driving-progress-sdgs Local financial magazine about the launch of the Accelerate2030 program https://pari.com.mk/accelerate2030-seavus/ Macedonian News –aggregator time.mk quick search on all the articles around the Launch of the Accelerate2030 program https://time.mk/c/13d272ae15/undp-seavus-akcelerator-i-biznis-impakt-lab-zapocnuvaat-sorabotka-za-sproveduvanje-na-programata-accelerate2030.html The publication/blogpost Fridays at the Lab has been shared by a key startup entity on their social media. The startup Challenger has been a part of the Fridays at the Lab sessions and has thus shared this content, because it showcased their participation in our UNDP country office. Our accelerator Lab team was invited to take part in the E-society.mk international conference, to talk about our approach of learning and working, and our participation to that event, as well as our talking points has been reshared on the social media pages of the Metamorphosis foundation [one of the key CSOs in our country when talking about digitalization and open data]. The publication/blogpost Ground Control to Major Tom has been shared by the UNHCR social media platforms in our country right after being published on the UNDP mk website and social media. The UNHCR social media platform has a different ecosystem and target groups, so it is a noteworthy example of expanding our ecosystem in reach. The office of the President of the Republic of North Macedonia issued a statement pertaining the development of the National Development Strategy (url: https://pretsedatel.mk/en/harmonized-unique-approach-to-drafting-a-document-for-long-term-development-strategy-of-the-republic-of-north-macedonia/)

1.1 - 2 new sources of data per year 1.2 - 1 different type of data sources per year 1.3 - 6 new potential solutions per lab per year 1.4 - 2 innovation methods per Action Plan 2.1 - 1 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2 - At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 - At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods. 2.4 - At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. 3.1 - The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 13 interaction by the end of year - 3.2 - 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3 - The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 1 time per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. - The Lab team engages at least once a week across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. 3.4 - Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. - Identify and engage with 2 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

The Lab was established at the end of 2020, the last member being on board on the 23rd of November. This did not allow much time for the lab to work towards the targets set for year 1. Based on the 100 days Action Plan and activities the Lab completed the followings can be outlined: 1.1. 2 new sources of date have been introduced (Global Entrepreneurship Index, Challenger application data presented at the Friday@the Lab) 1.2. 1 ethnographic research and data set collected from Old Bazar, and Suto Orizare 1.3. Solutions mapping: Open Agenda, Visualization of Strategies, Go-green, Turistico, NaTocak, bulk waste separation, Incentives/gamification for using alternative means of transport 1.4. Two innovation methods used per country LAB (co-design and future thinking and sense making) 2.1 one blog post published 4th of December 2.2 Governance learning challenge, National Development Strategy - public sector as a partner. 4 Deputy Prime Ministers a part of the Steering Committee of the process, City of Skopje 2.3 Co-design workshop was held with the ministry of Economy, and Ministry of Environment 2.4 NDS – feeds in directly to the Governance program in the CO 3.1 13 interactions with other LABs (Serbia, Bosna and Herzegovina, India, Georgia, Kyrgyzstan, Saudi Arabia, Mexico, Ukraine, Turkey, Belarus, El Salvador, Panama) 3.2 Blog posts on System transformation highlight the knowledge of different methodologies that we have been exploring, and sharing with the outer network. 3.3 One per month in December and January, and more then two times in February, 2021 Team actively engages in LinkedIn and initiates discussions with the ecosystems at least once in a week.
